articles.author: Ronaldo Marquez
articles.description:
The Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) has launched an investigation into the Chicago-based trading firm Jump’s participation in the crypto market, focusing on its trading and investment activities, according to an undisclosed source familiar with the matter, as reported by Fortune Magazine.
 
Hacks And Collapses Haunt Jump Trading
 
The investigation comes after a tumultuous period for Jump, which has been recognized for its expertise in algorithmic trading. However, the company faced setbacks, including being linked to a series of hacks and collapses. 
 
The company suffered a major blow with the $325 million hack of Wormhole, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform designed to bridge separate blockchains. 
 
 
Moreover, following the collapse of FTX in November 2022, it was rev…
articles.title: BREAKING: CFTC Launches Crypto Investigation Into Jump Trading

articles.author: Tareq Sikder
articles.description:
Today (Thursday), it was disclosed that Bitflyer, a Japanese  
cryptocurrency exchange, has acquired the Japanese operations of FTX, which had  
previously filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in November 2022. FTX  
Japan was among over 100 affiliated entities included in the bankruptcy  
proceedings.
Asset Segregation Raises Recovery Hopes
In contrast to its parent company, FTX Japan reported having  
more assets than liabilities, with approximately $134 million in user assets  
segregated from FTX Trading. This distinction raised hopes for the potential  
recovery of funds belonging to Japanese customers.
Bitcoin.com News reported over a year and five months ago  
that FTX Japan customers would gradually be allowed to withdraw their assets.  
Founded by Yuzo Kano, a former Goldman…
articles.title: Bitflyer Takes the Reins: Acquiring FTX Japan amid Bankruptcy Fallout

articles.author: Jared Kirui
articles.description:
TradingView has integrated data from Crypto.com, one  
of the leading global crypto exchanges. This addition aims to enrich the  
analytical tools available on TradingView and to make it easier for traders to  
explore and understand digital asset trading. 
Enhancing User Experience
The integration of Crypto.com data into TradingView is  
a strategic step towards creating a more comprehensive and accessible trading  
experience. This move aligns with TradingView’s vision to provide seamless  
access to a wide array of financial instruments and data feeds.
By incorporating Crypto.com’s extensive data coverage,  
TradingView users can now access real-time insights on over 700 crypto assets. This  
new feature aims to simplify access to the market by users. Users can open the  
chart and ente…
articles.title: TradingView Integrates Crypto.com Data, Expanding Access to 700+ Digital Assets

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
Bitcoin miners, the backbone of the world’s largest cryptocurrency, are experiencing a dramatic shift in their behavior. Data from IntoTheBlock reveals a surprising trend: miner reserves have sunk to their lowest level in 14 years, raising concerns about the future of Bitcoin mining. However, a closer look suggests this might be a case of shrewd adaptation rather than a mass exodus.
 
 
Halving Headaches: Balancing Rewards And Risk
 
The culprit behind this shift is the recent Bitcoin halving event in April 2024. Roughly every four years, the number of Bitcoins awarded to miners for validating transactions is cut in half. This time around, the reward dropped from 6.25 BTC to 3.125 BTC. While this might seem like a minor decrease, it significantly impacts miner profitability.
 
The halving …
articles.title: Bitcoin Miners Feeling The Squeeze: Reserves Dry Up To 14-Year Lows

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description: According to a local report, the Japan-based crypto exchange Bitflyer has acquired the failed Japanese unit of FTX. The report indicates that arrangements are currently underway to take over the business. Bitflyer Acquires Bankrupt FTX Japan, Local Report Claims On June 20, 2024, NHK reported that Japan’s Bitflyer acquired the now-defunct Japanese unit of FTX. […]
articles.title: Bitflyer Takes Over FTX’s Defunct Japanese Unit: NHK

articles.author: Frank Corva
articles.description:
At the 2024 Bitcoin Policy Summit, Nicaraguan pro-democracy activist Félix Maradiaga shared his insights on the severe challenges facing his country, which is under the autocratic rule of Daniel Ortega.

According to Maradiaga, the Nicaraguan people are losing their freedoms at an alarming rate.
“According to the Freedom in the World report, we have the very unfortunate label of being the country that over the last year has lost the most freedoms,” Maradiaga told Bitcoin Magazine.
“Imagine a country in which you could go to prison for raising the national flag, for tweeting, for receiving a remittance from an international donor or for expressing your opinions on social media,” he added.
“That's the situation in Nicaragua.”
Maradiaga pointed out that 130 individuals are currently being arb…
articles.title: Bitcoin's Role In Defending Democracy In Nicaragua With Félix Maradiaga

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description: This month, several cryptocurrency exchanges are delisting certain stablecoins to align with the European Union’s Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) regulations, which establish more stringent rules for fiat-backed and algorithmic stablecoins in the European Economic Area (EEA). Uphold announced it will delist a selection of stablecoins on July 1, and Binance has recently removed stablecoin funding […]
articles.title: Crypto Exchanges Brace for EU’s MiCA Rules: Stablecoins Delisted by Uphold, Binance

articles.author: Fernando Nikolic
articles.description:
The media is buzzing about Trump's recent endorsement of Bitcoin.
Looking at Bitcoin Perception data (chart below), coverage of Bitcoin together with Trump has increased month-over-month since the start of the year, but last week saw quite a stir, since the endorsement seems to be amplifying an already existing anti-Bitcoin bias among some outlets.
 
                         
                         
                        Image credit: Mainstream media coverage of Trump + Bitcoin has increased since the start of 2024. (Bitcoin Perception) 
                     
                    
Forbes, Fox, and CNBC covered Trump's move as a positive step for U.S. energy security and economic strength. They highlight how Bitcoin mining could boost energy dominance and act as a defense against centra…
articles.title: Left-Leaning Outlets Amplify Their Anti-Bitcoin Bias Following Trump's Endorsement

articles.author: Scott Matherson
articles.description:
Shiba Inu’s adoption rate is growing at an alarming rate as it scores another major adoption with the popular digital asset exchange Crypto.com’s latest announcement. The crypto exchange has included Shiba Inu for its Visa card payments, alongside several other popular meme coins.
 
Crypto.Com Expands Support For Shiba Inu
 
Crypto.com has unveiled the incorporation of Shiba Inu into its platform’s Visa card. The crypto exchange made this announcement on June 19 in an X (formerly Twitter) post, disclosing its support for Shiba Inu and other major meme coins such as Floki, PEPE, and Dogwifhat (WIF) for its Visa card. 
 
 
The Crypto.com Visa card is a crypto prepaid card programme which works similar to a regular debit card but can be used for digital asset transactions and ATM withdrawals.…
articles.title: Shiba Inu Scores Another Major Adoption With Latest Crypto.Com Announcement

articles.author: Nik Hoffman
articles.description:
MicroStrategy, a leading business intelligence and software company, has continued its steadfast commitment to Bitcoin by purchasing an additional 11,931 BTC at a total cost of $786 million.

BREAKING: MicroStrategy buys an additional 11,931 #Bitcoin for $786 million. pic.twitter.com/H7XN5XtBtK
— Bitcoin Magazine (@BitcoinMagazine) June 20, 2024
  
  
  
On June 18, MicroStrategy completed a private offering of convertible senior notes, which included a 2.25% coupon and an approximately 35% conversion premium over the U.S. composite volume weighted average price of MicroStrategy’s class A common stock. The offering was well received in the marketplace and upsized to a total of $800.0 million in aggregate principal amount, MicroStrategy stated. This amount included the exercise by the initi…
articles.title: MicroStrategy Bought 11,931 More Bitcoin For $786 Million

articles.author: Kevin Helms
articles.description: Nasdaq-listed Microstrategy has acquired 11,931 more bitcoins for $786 million, raising its total cryptocurrency holdings to 226,331 bitcoins, valued at $8.33 billion with an average purchase price of $36,798 per coin. The acquisition was funded through proceeds from a private offering of convertible senior notes that offer a 2.25% annual interest rate. MSTR Now Hodls […]
articles.title: Microstrategy Increases Bitcoin Portfolio to 226,331 BTC After Latest Purchase
